title: Former Karnataka minister Bheemanna Khandre passes away at 102
description: Veteran freedom fighter and former Karnataka minister Bheemanna Khandre has passed away at 102. A prominent Congress leader and cooperative movement stalwart, Khandre served as Transport Minister and was instrumental in keeping Bidar district within Karnataka. His contributions to agriculture and education were significant. He is survived by his son, current Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre.

title: BJP takes control of Mumbai for first time, but needs Shinde Sena for majority
description: In a stunning political shift, the BJP has taken control of Mumbai's Municipal Corporation (BMC), effectively ending the Thackeray family's nearly thirty-year dominance over the city's civic governance. The Mahayuti coalition, spearheaded by the BJP alongside Eknath Shinde's faction of the Shiv Sena, has surpassed the majority threshold, with the BJP poised to appoint the new mayor.

Migrant workers from other States who had been registered in two locations must now choose one

title: BMC polls: Only traditional bastions back UBT-MNS’s ‘save Marathis’ plank
description: In a historic attempt to unify Marathi voters in the BMC elections, the Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS alliance stumbled despite their efforts after a long hiatus. Holding onto their territories in south and central Mumbai, the Thackeray legacy struggled against the BJP's formidable push, especially in the affluent western suburbs.

description: A male elephant, which has killed at least 20 people in the Chaibasa and Kolhan forest areas of West Singhbhum district, has become the symbol of the human-wildlife conflict in Jharkhand. A massive operation involving more than 100 forest personnel is under way to track the animal. Amit Bhelari reports on the attacks, which have led to panic in the villages, and the ongoing search

description: During a heated press briefing, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt confronted a journalist regarding a deadly ICE shooting, branding his inquiries as one-sided and accusing him of partisanship.

title: Fundamental shift from savers to investors: What are Indian households doing with their money?
description: Indian households are shifting from traditional savings like gold and cash to market-linked investments such as mutual funds and equities. This trend, accelerated by digital access and financial literacy, sees a significant rise in individual investors, particularly younger demographics and women, seeking inflation-beating returns.

title: Nipah virus has a high fatality rate: Doctor shares what makes the virus dangerous
description: Nipah virus, a deadly bat-borne illness, has resurfaced in West Bengal, raising concerns after past outbreaks in India.  Initial symptoms mimic common fevers, leading to delayed diagnosis.  With a high fatality rate and no cure, early detection and isolation are crucial.  Experts urge vigilance as the virus progresses rapidly, causing severe neurological issues.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt's heartfelt life update amid team's tough season
description: The Kansas City Chiefs had a pretty disappointing season this time, but the billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has always been there for the team. Amid all the mess, Gracie Hunt has made a wholesome post about her life along with a few inspirational words that has moved fans. With the team's poor performance, many of their players are also getting trolled brutally.

title: Travis Kelce sparks tension with Taylor Swift amid post-football life stress
description: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about Travis Kelce’s emotional well-being as he considers retirement from the NFL. Insiders say football has long defined Kelce’s identity, making the transition difficult. While opportunities await beyond the game, the uncertainty has created stress. Kelce has acknowledged the challenge publicly while evaluating his physical readiness and future.

title: Nvidia CEO advocates zero coding for engineers; this is what he wants them to do instead
description: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang aims for engineers to code zero percent, leveraging AI assistants like Cursor to tackle complex, undiscovered problems. He believes this 'Purpose vs Task' approach, akin to radiology's evolution, will elevate human roles. While some, like Cursor's CEO, caution against unchecked AI development, Huang remains confident in this human-centric future for innovation.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14bn — now they’re clashing
description: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.
